required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase I Study of Hemay102 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Dose Escalation Phase I Clinical Study Evaluating the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Antitumor Efficacy of Hemay102 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Hemay Oncology Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Hemay Oncology Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd

brief_summary.textblock: This trial was a single-center, open-label, dose-increasing Phase I clinical study with subjects enrolled in patients with advanced solid tumors who failed standard treatment or who were unable to receive effective treatment. The trial is divided into two stages: dose escalation and dose extension.

detailed_description.textblock:
Dose escalation:
A total of 7 dosage groups were set at this stage, which were 5 mg/m2, 10 mg/m2, 20 mg/m2, 40 mg/m2, 60 mg/m2, 90 mg/m2, and 120 mg/m2, respectively. Accelerated dosage titration was performed in the first 3 dose groups, 1 subject was enrolled in each group; the last 4 dose groups were perfromed into dosage groups by the principle of "3+3" dose increment rule, and the number of subjects enrolled in each group is 3 to 6 cases.
Dose extension:
According to the test results of the dose escalation phase, two extensions of MTD (tentative 60 mg/m2, 90 mg/m2) were selected for the expansion trial. Each dose level was planned to enroll 6 subjects (12 in total), subjects were administered once every 3 weeks (1 treatment cycle every 3 weeks), and received 4 treatment cycles in a row for Hemay102. Safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetic characteristics, and initial anti-tumor efficacy were evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline until 4 weeks after the study day
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with adverse events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At screening, every 6 weeks of treatment up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate (complete response rate + partial response rate) according to RECIST v1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At screening, every 6 weeks of treatment up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical benefit rate defined as percentage of patients with stable disease (SD) ≥ 6 months/partial response (PR)/complete response (CR). according to RECIST v1.1
Progression Free Survival defined as the proportion of patients alive and without progression (according to RECIST v1.1 criteria)
Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve of Hemay102

clinical_study.condition: Patients With Advanced Stage Solid Tumors

arm_group.description: Hemay102 will be administered to patients through i.v. drip for 4hrs at the dosage of 5mg/m2.
Hemay102 will be administered to patients through i.v. drip for 4hrs at the dosage of 10mg/m2.
Hemay102 will be administered to patients through i.v. drip for 4hrs at the dosage of 20mg/m2.
Hemay102 will be administered to patients through i.v. drip for 4hrs at the dosage of 40mg/m2.
Hemay102 will be administered to patients through i.v. drip for 4hrs at the dosage of 60mg/m2.
Hemay102 will be administered to patients through i.v. drip for 4hrs at the dosage of 90mg/m2.
Hemay102 will be administered to patients through i.v. drip for 4hrs at the dosage of 120mg/m2.

intervention.description: Hemay102 was administered through i.v. infusion for 4hrs.
